perturbation.original_text: To:                 Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., not individually, but solely as                     Master Servicer on behalf of Wells Fargo Mortgage Backed                     Securities 2006-6 Trust ("Counterparty")
perturbation.changed_text: To:                 Wells Fargo Bank, N.A., not individually, but solely as                     Master Servicer on behalf of Wells Fargo Mortgage Backed                     Securities 2006-6 Trust ("Client")
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement consistently uses 'Counterparty' to refer to Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. changing this to 'Client' introduces confusion about the roles and responsibilities throughout the rest of the document, especially concerning payment obligations and termination events.

perturbation.original_text:
Seller of the Cap:                UBS AG

Buyer of the Cap:                 Counterparty

Calculation Agent:                UBS AG
perturbation.changed_text:
Seller of the Cap:                UBS AG

Buyer of the Cap:                 Client

Calculation Agent:                UBS AG
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Counterparty' to 'Client' here adds to the confusion about roles. The agreement refers to 'Counterparty' throughout, defining them as responsible for specific actions (e.g., paying the Fixed Amount). Introducing 'Client' creates ambiguity as to who bears these responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text: (xii) Fully Paid Transaction. Notwithstanding the terms of Sections 5 and             6 of the Agreement, if Counterparty has satisfied all of its payment             obligations under Section 2(a)(i) of the Agreement with respect to             this Transaction, and unless UBS AG is required to return (whether             pursuant to an order of a court with due authority to cause UBS AG             to be required to return any such payment to Counterparty (or any             duly authorized representative thereof) or whether otherwise             pursuant to appropriate proceedings to return to Counterparty (or             any duly authorized representative thereof)) or UBS AG otherwise             returns to Counterparty (or any duly authorized representative             thereof) upon demand of Counterparty (or any duly authorized             representative thereof) any portion of such payment, then: (a) the             occurrence of an event described in Section 5(a) of the Agreement             with respect to Counterparty shall not constitute an Event of             Default or Potential Event of Default with respect to Counterparty             as the Defaulting Party in respect of this Transaction and (b) UBS             AG shall be entitled to designate an Early Termination Date pursuant             to Section 6 of the Agreement in respect of this Transaction only as             a result of a Termination Event set forth in either Section 5(b)(i)             or Section 5(b)(ii) of the Agreement with respect to UBS AG as the             Affected Party or Section 5(b)(iii) of the Agreement with respect to             UBS AG as the Burdened Party. For purposes of the Transaction to             which this Confirmation relates, Counterparty's only obligation             under Section 2(a)(i) of the Agreement is to pay the Fixed Amount on             the Fixed Rate Payer Payment Date, each as defined in this             Confirmation.
perturbation.changed_text: (xii) Fully Paid Transaction. Notwithstanding the terms of Sections 5 and             6 of the Agreement, if Client has satisfied all of its payment             obligations under Section 2(a)(i) of the Agreement with respect to             this Transaction, and unless UBS AG is required to return (whether             pursuant to an order of a court with due authority to cause UBS AG             to be required to return any such payment to Client (or any             duly authorized representative thereof) or whether otherwise             pursuant to appropriate proceedings to return to Client (or             any duly authorized representative thereof)) or UBS AG otherwise             returns to Client (or any duly authorized representative             thereof) upon demand of Client (or any duly authorized             representative thereof) any portion of such payment, then: (a) the             occurrence of an event described in Section 5(a) of the Agreement             with respect to Client shall not constitute an Event of             Default or Potential Event of Default with respect to Client             as the Defaulting Party in respect of this Transaction and (b) UBS             AG shall be entitled to designate an Early Termination Date pursuant             to Section 6 of the Agreement in respect of this Transaction only as             a result of a Termination Event set forth in either Section 5(b)(i)             or Section 5(b)(ii) of the Agreement with respect to UBS AG as the             Affected Party or Section 5(b)(iii) of the Agreement with respect to             UBS AG as the Burdened Party. For purposes of the Transaction to             which this Confirmation relates, Client's only obligation             under Section 2(a)(i) of the Agreement is to pay the Fixed Amount on             the Fixed Rate Payer Payment Date, each as defined in this             Confirmation.
perturbation.explanation: Consistently changing 'Counterparty' to 'Client' within this section creates direct conflict. Some sections still use 'Counterparty', while others now use 'Client'. This makes it uncertain which entity is bound by the obligations, especially concerning the 'Fully Paid Transaction' clause and payment responsibilities.
